authors.note: Created for BIT 595 Portable Genome Sequencing Course Fall 2024

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"28lf3","text":"This protocol can be used to perform multiplex sequencing of a virome using Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cebk2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24mhc","text":"Forty RNA samples, including blood (n = 10), fecal (n = 10), epithelial (n = 10) and mucosal (n = 10) collected using cotton swabs from 10 wild Eastern Cottontail rabbits and stored at -80 °C. The 40 samples were combined into four pools each composed of ten samples of the same type. Sequencing was performed using the cDNA-PCR kit from ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Oxford Nanopores Technologies, ONT, Nanopore, Nanopore sequencing

steps.section: Pre-processing of Samples: Blood, Fecal, Epithelial, and Mucosal (Salival)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1cjv","text":"Place each swab in a 1.5-mL centrifuge tube with   of phosphate buffered saline (PBS). PBS is an isotonic solution that prevents the rupture of cells or shriveling of cells due to osmosis and is a non-toxic formulation for the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bleic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rkon","text":"Note: An incubation time of 30–90 seconds to add a 3’ adenosine homopolymer (poly(A) tail) of approximately 50-100 nucleotides in length. An increase in incubation time will result in longer poly(A) tails. The maximum incubation time is 5 minutes and longer timings may result in a lower total sequencing yield. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ip34","text":"Optional Step: It is recommended that EDTA be removed before starting any sequencing kit protocols.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"i9cp","text":"Add  of RNase-free SPRI beads to the reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9t1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"45","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38bgu","text":"Incubate on a Hula Mixer for  at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69v60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c7a4h","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6l5u","text":". Keep the tube on the magnet and pipette off and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rkft","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with 200 µl of freshly-prepared 70% ethanol. Carefully turn the tube 180° twice in the rack to wash pelleted beads. Pippette off and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"arjdq","text":"Repeat the previous step for a total of two washes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a8fbc","text":"Briefly spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv699","text":"Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for  , but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fb69r","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in   of nuclease-free water. Incubate on ice for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"12","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aae65","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7dvn","text":"Remove and retain   of eluate containing the 3’-polyadenylated RNA in a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"12","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dp5av","text":"Remove  of final eluate and quantify the final concentration using HS RNA Qubit kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d47uq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dm62","text":"Optional step: Dilute the final eluate to 100 ng/µl and quantify   using Agilent 6000 Nano RNA kit, using total RNA or mRNA setting depending on the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fp5rs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"af42f","text":"Store the final product at   or proceed immediately with the library preparation, keeping your sample on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7tvo6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6u4t","text":"Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT) protocols recommend an input quantity in mass. The Direct RNA Sequencing Kit (SQK-RNA004) from ONT is used to prepare RNA for nanopore sequencing from an input of as low as   poly(A)+ RNA or   of total RNA (additional optimization may be required for total RNA). Therefore, it is important to assess the input RNA to determine if it is of high enough quality and amount to be used in direct RNA sequencing. The following protocol is described by ONT for assessing input RNA:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":208,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":226,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":489,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"1l1n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E27FB85430614FB48E5D3CDDF1166B7A","url":"https://nanoporetech.com/document/input-dna-rna-qc"}}}}
